Title: SC orders non-invasive ASI survey of Gyanvapi complex, refuses to stay Allahabad HC order
Content:
Gyanvapi complex at Varanasi, UP (img: Wikimedia Commons)

In a major setback to the Masjid Committee, the Supreme Court today refused to stay the Allahabad High CourtтАЩs order directing the ASI (Archaeological Survey of India) for a survey of the Gyanvapi mosque complex.

A three-judge Supreme Court bench, led by the chief justice of India (CJI) DY Chandrachud said, тАЬWe direct that the entire survey to be carried out through non-invasive method and also there should be no excavation or damage to the walls or structure of the mosque.тАЭ

тАЬWe are of the view not to interfere with the Allahabad High Court's order,тАЭ the CJI Dr Chandrachud said, while hearing an appeal filed by the Masjid Committee. 

The Supreme Court in its order said that the ASI wouldnтАЩt damage the structure as it preserves monuments. All the parties can file objections to the ASI survey.

The Apex Court said that ASIтАЩs job was to maintain such properties and so there shall be no such damage.

The top court, also comprising Justices JB Pardiwala and Justice Manoj Mishra, said, тАЬe direct the entire survey to be carried out through non-invasive method and also there should be no excavation or damage to the walls or structure of the mosque.тАЭ

The Apex Court also took into record of the Solicitor General (SG) Tushar Mehta that there will be no excavation or damage to even a brick of the mosqueтАЩs wall or structure.

Senior lawyer Huzefa Ahmadi, appearing for Masjid Committee, during the course of the hearing, said that if tomorrow someone files a frivolous suit and asks for a survey as to whether there is something below, will you allow ASI survey? 

The CJI replied that what is frivolous to you is faith to the other side. How can we comment on if it is frivolous or not?

тАЬWe will safeguard your interest by saying that no damage should be done to the premises,тАЭ the Supreme Court said, in its order today. 

The Supreme Court passed the order after hearing an appeal filed by the Masjid committee challenging the Allahabad High Court's order directing the ASI to conduct a survey in the Gyanvapi mosque complex.

The Allahabad high court on Aug 3  had ordered that the ASI would conduct survey on the Gyanvapi mosque complex in Varanasi.

Title: Will NHAIтАЩs new app revolutionise the highway experience?
Content:
In an effort to improve the highway user experience, the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) launched the тАШRajmargyatraтАЩ app on Aug 3. Currently, available in English and Hindi, it is a citizen-centric unified mobile application and can be downloaded via the Google Play Store and the iOS App Store.

What is the тАШRajmargyatraтАЩ app?

The app will provide citizens with information about IndiaтАЩs highways and the grievance redressal system. It is designed to let commuters know about any events or issues on the highway they are travelling on.

How will the Rajmargyatra app help you?

1. Through this app, the users will get comprehensive information about the highway network of India. It will also provide real-time weather conditions, timely broadcast notifications, and access to details about nearby toll plazas, petrol pumps, hospitals, hotels, and other essential services. 

2. Users will be able to report any highway-related issues by attaching geo-tagged videos or photos. The complaints are said to be addressed in a time-bound manner. Moreover, the complainant can also track the status of their grievances for complete transparency.

3. The services of this app are integrated with various bank portals so that FASTag users can easily recharge their FASTag account. The app will offer monthly passes and access to other FASTag-related banking services.

Title: SC stays RahulтАЩs conviction in тАШModi surnameтАЩ defamation case
Content:
Congress MP from Wayanad, Rahul Gandhi (img: IANS)

In a big win for Rahul Gandhi, the Supreme Court on Friday stayed the conviction of the former Congress President in the тАШModi surnameтАЩ defamation case, which cost him his Lok Sabha membership, saying that no reasons were given by the trial judge for imposing the maximum punishment of two years in the case.

тАЬIf a constituency in Parliament goes unrepresented, is it not a relevant ground (to suspend conviction)? No whisper by the trial judge for the need to impose the maximum sentence. Not only the right of one individual is being affected, but the entire electorate of the constituency,тАЭ observed a bench comprising of Justices B R Gavai, PS Narasimha, and Prashant Kumar Mishra during the hearing. We have of the considered view that the ramifications of Section 5 are wide, the SC said.

The bench, however, noted that "Gandhi should have been more careful in making the alleged remarks."

The Judgment is stayed until the larger appeal is heard on merits, a bench of the Supreme Court, headed by Justice BR Gavai said in his order.

Further, the bench remarked that had Gandhi been awarded a sentence of 1 year, 11 months and 29 days, he would have been not disqualified as a Member of Parliament.

Senior advocate Abhishek Manu Singhvi, appearing for Gandhi, termed the conviction as тАЬstrangeтАЭ while referring to many other judgements of the Supreme Court to justify that GandhiтАЩs conviction in the case deserves to be suspended. тАЬEverybody aggrieved is a BJP office-bearer or a karyakarta (party worker),тАЭ he said.

"There is no doubt that the utterances by the petitioner is not in good taste," Justice Gavai, noted in his order.

On the other hand, senior advocate Jethamalani, appearing for the complainant BJP MLA in the defamation case, said that GandhiтАЩs intention was to defame every person with the surname тАШModiтАЩ just because it is the same as that of a Prime Minister.

The Supreme Court was hearing the plea filed by the former Congress president against the Gujarat High Court's verdict refusing a stay on his conviction in the тАШModi surname' defamation case.

On July 15, the Congress leader had approached the Supreme Court challenging the Gujarat high courtтАЩs order where a bench of Justice Hemant Prachchhak had observed that granting a stay on his conviction would be an exception, and not a rule.

Gandhi was disqualified as an MP in March, after a Surat court convicted him and sentenced him to two years in prison for his тАШModiтАЩ remark made during an election rally in Karnataka in April 2019. Gandhi's remark was interpreted as an attempt to draw an implicit connection between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and fugitive businessmen Nirav Modi and Lalit Modi.

In March, the sessions court in Surat had dismissed Gandhi's plea seeking suspension of his conviction by the magistrate court, stating that his disqualification will not result in an irreversible loss to him. The Congress leader was disqualified under a rule that bars convicted MPs from holding the Lok Sabha membership.

According to legal experts, after the stay has been granted by the top court on Rahul GandhiтАЩs conviction, it will be sufficient to restore his Lok Sabha membership.

(Source: IANS)

Title: Planning a Euro trip? Embassy says wait till October
Content:
Switzerland flag; Switzerland embassy in New Delhi (img: Facebook, Envato Elements)

The Switzerland embassy located in New Delhi announced today that it will suspend Schengen visa applications from Indians. This order will remain in existence until Oct this year. As per the embassy, this decision is being taken keeping in mind the inflow of applications they are receiving being excessive against the shortage of their staff.

The Schengen visa allows a virtually borderless travel visa for the holder to any of the 26 member countries. The visa holder can have the freedom to travel within the member countries for tourism or business purposes for up to 90 days.

Staff shortages resulting in visa processing delays

The Swiss embassy in Delhi has stated that it will suspend visa applications for Indians until Oct this year. The primary reason cited for this issue was the working capacity of the Swiss embassy, as they are running short on staff, state sources.

This has also resulted in disappointment among tour operators. According to a report, tour operators make significant profits from group tours across Europe. However, some reports have mentioned that group appointments have not been suspended by the embassy.

Chinese travellers affected as well

The staff shortage at Swiss embassies has also caused hindrances for Chinese travellers applying for the Schengen visa. COVID-19 is also considered one of the factors impacting the embassies handling of the surge in visa applications.
